title: I'm moving, how do I transfer my WM service?
content:
Before we can help you transfer your service we need a few things:

• The date you are moving
• Your new address
• When you would like service to start at your new address

**Transfer Residential Services**

**Single Account Linked:**
1. Log in to My WM and navigate to the "Do More Online" card.
2. Click on the Moving option to transfer your service online.
3. Follow the instructions and submit your request.

**Multiple Accounts Linked:**
1. Log in to My WM and navigate to the "My Services" card and select Adjust Service.
2. Click Moving on the current location, follow the instructions, and submit your request.

**Want to Cancel Instead?**
If you are moving and no longer need WM service, contact customer service to cancel your service.

I'm moving, how do I transfer my WM service?

title: What materials are not allowed in my roll-off dumpster?
content:
Here are some general guidelines of items that are NOT allowed in dumpsters:

**Prohibited Items:**
• Aerosol cans
• All liquids
• Animals
• Antifreeze
• Appliances
• Asbestos
• Barrels
• Batteries
• Chemical products
• Computers
• Contaminated oils (mixed with solvents, gasoline, etc.)
• Dirt
• Fluorescent tubes
• Hazardous waste
• Herbicides and pesticides
• Industrial waste
• Lubricating/hydraulic oil
• Mattresses (For customers located in Massachusetts)
• Medical waste
• Microwaves
• Monitors
• Motor oil
• Oil filters
• Other flammable liquids
• Paint (except dried latex paint cans, no liquids)
• Petroleum-contaminated soil/lead paint chips
• Propane tanks
• Radioactive material
• Railroad ties
• Solvents
• Televisions
• Tires
• Transmission oil
• Yard Waste (not available in MN, ND, SD, and WI)

**Additional Restrictions for Larger Dumpsters (30+ Yard Containers):**
• Concrete
• Bricks
• Demolition material

What materials are not allowed in my roll-off dumpster?

title: What types of compactors are available?
content:
Make your trash and recycling pickups even more efficient and cost-effective by choosing a compactor solution. A trash compactor is often used by a home or business to reduce the volume of trash it produces.

**Available Options:**
• Traditional compactor with monitoring service
• SmartEnergy solar-powered compactor

WM can help you optimize every pickup with the right compactor solution for your needs. Visit our Business Waste Compactors page to learn more and contact us for a quote.

title: Does WM provide portable toilets?
content:
Our on-site sanitation needs vary as much as your project or event. We will help you accommodate your team's needs the right way, with clean and easy-to-schedule sanitation solutions.

**Portable Toilet Options:**

**Single-stall portable toilets:**
• Single occupant
• Typically run about 3 ft (90 cm) by 7 ft (210 cm)
• Primarily free-standing structures
• Models include toilet paper, some with antibacterial hand-gel dispensers
• Availability varies by location

**Trailer-sized portable restroom stations:**
• Approximately 7 single-stalls in capacity
• Units vary from 6-8 stalls for men, women or unisex
• Amenities vary (i.e., running water in the sinks and toilets)
• May require a source of electricity, but some units have the ability to be self-sufficient via onboard 500-gallon water storage
• Availability varies by location

title: Will the pricing structure look different with the transition from Advanced Disposal to WM?
content: The overall Fuel Surcharge will be adjusted slightly; it will now fluctuate per invoice, based on WM's Collection Fuel Surcharge Table. Your Advanced Disposal Environmental and Compliance Business Impact Charge rates – if applicable – will remain the same for now but in the future will be transitioned to WM's standards. We will communicate with you at the time that transition occurs.

title: What should I do if my pickup was missed?
content:
Before reporting a missed pickup:
• Ensure access to your container is clear; lids close; gates/locks are open; container was placed out the night before; no unacceptable/hazardous materials.
• Allow until 6 p.m. local time for pickup to occur.

Check schedule & alerts:
• Go to Schedule & ETA and log in or enter your address to view alerts or service interruptions.

Report a missed pickup (eligible accounts):
• Log in to My WM → My Services/Manage My Services → select the service address/container → use **Report a Missed Pickup** and follow steps.
• Missed pickups can only be reported for successful service attempts and within 3 days of the scheduled date.

If you can’t report online:
• The button may be unavailable if the cart wasn’t at curb, weather/road conditions prevented service, access was blocked, or the date is >3 days past. Use Live Chat (**Request Help**) for assistance.

Notes:
• Monetary credits are ordinarily not offered for missed/delayed pickups. If material must be removed sooner, you can request an extra pickup.
alt_questions: About: what should i do if my pickup was missed
What should I do if my pickup was missed?

title: What can I recycle?
content:
You can typically recycle the following items:

**Paper & Cardboard:**
• Newspapers, magazines, office paper
• Cardboard (flattened boxes)
• Paper bags

**Plastics:**
• Containers marked with recycling symbols #1 (PETE) and #2 (HDPE)
• Plastic bottles and jugs
• Clean plastic containers

**Metals:**
• Aluminum cans (like soda cans)
• Tin cans
• Steel cans

**Glass:**
• Clear, green, and brown glass bottles and jars
• Glass containers (remove lids)

**Important Notes:**
• Rinse out containers before recycling
• Remove any non-recyclable materials
• Check with your local service for specific guidelines
• Recycling guidelines can vary by location

What can I recycle?

title: How do I avoid overage charges?
content:
Overage charges occur when your container exceeds the weight limit for your service level. Here's how to avoid them:

**Prevention Tips:**
• Monitor your container weight and don't overfill
• Consider upgrading to a larger container if you consistently exceed limits
• Distribute heavy items across multiple pickup days
• Remove excess packaging before disposal
• Use recycling services to reduce trash volume

**Weight Limits:**
• 32-gallon container: Typically 50-75 lbs
• 64-gallon container: Typically 100-150 lbs
• 96-gallon container: Typically 150-200 lbs

**If You Receive an Overage Charge:**
• Review your service level and consider upgrading
• Contact customer service to discuss your options
• Check if you qualify for a one-time courtesy adjustment

How do I avoid overage charges?

title: What is the energy surcharge on my invoice for?
content:
The energy surcharge on your invoice covers the fluctuating costs of fuel and energy used in waste collection and processing operations.

**What It Covers:**
• Fuel costs for collection vehicles
• Energy costs for processing facilities
• Transportation costs to disposal sites
• Equipment operation costs

**How It's Calculated:**
• Based on current fuel and energy market prices
• Adjusted monthly to reflect actual costs
• Applied as a percentage of your base service rate
• Varies by service area and market conditions

**Why It's Separate:**
• Allows for transparent pricing of base services
• Reflects actual operational costs
• Provides flexibility to adjust for market fluctuations

**Current Rate:**
Check your latest invoice for the current energy surcharge percentage in your area.

What is the energy surcharge on my invoice for?

title: Why do I have a contamination charge in my bill?
content:
Contamination charges occur when non-recyclable materials are found in your recycling container, requiring additional processing.

**Common Contamination Issues:**
• Food waste in recycling containers
• Plastic bags in recycling
• Non-recyclable plastics (numbers 3-7)
• Hazardous materials
• Electronics or batteries
• Styrofoam or foam packaging

**How to Avoid Contamination Charges:**
• Only place accepted recyclables in your recycling container
• Rinse containers before recycling
• Remove lids and labels when required
• Check local recycling guidelines
• Use your trash container for non-recyclables

**What Happens When Contaminated:**
• Additional processing required
• May result in entire load being sent to landfill
• Contamination fee applied to cover extra costs

**Prevention Tips:**
• When in doubt, throw it out (in trash, not recycling)
• Keep recycling guidelines handy
• Educate household members on proper recycling

title: Do you offer yard waste pickup service?
content:
Availability and guidelines for yard/green waste vary by area.

New customer:
• Use Schedule & ETA: enter your address to check eligibility and options.

Existing customer:
• Log in to My WM → My Services/Manage My Services to see if yard/green waste can be added to your existing account. If you don’t see the option, click **Request Help**.

On-call yard waste:
• If offered in your area, schedule a one-time on-call yard waste pickup under Bulk items.

Seasonal yard waste:
• Seasonal availability varies by area. Check Schedule & ETA or use **Request Help** for assistance.

Materials guidelines:
• See **What counts as yard waste** for acceptable/unacceptable items and local rules.

Do you offer yard waste pickup service?

title: My container is damaged, how do I get a replacement?
content:
If your container is damaged, we can help you get a replacement quickly.

**Types of Damage Covered:**
• Cracked or broken wheels
• Damaged lid or hinges
• Holes or cracks in container body
• Broken handles or latches
• Normal wear and tear

**How to Request Replacement:**
1. **Contact Customer Service**: Call or use our chat assistant
2. **Report the Issue**: Describe the type of damage
3. **Schedule Delivery**: New container typically delivered within 1-2 service days
4. **Remove Old Container**: Place damaged container at curb for pickup

**What's Included:**
• Free replacement for normal wear and tear
• Delivery of new container
• Pickup of damaged container
• No additional charges for standard replacements

**Customer-Caused Damage:**
• Damage from misuse may incur replacement fees
• Fees vary by container size and damage type
• Contact customer service for pricing

**Temporary Solutions:**
• Continue using damaged container until replacement arrives
• Place extra bags next to container if needed
• Contact us if container becomes unusable

My container is damaged, how do I get a replacement?

title: What are my pickup days and schedule?
content:
Your pickup schedule depends on your service area and location.

**How to Find Your Schedule:**
1. **Check Your Service Area**: Look up your address in our service area finder
2. **Contact Customer Service**: Call or chat with us for your specific schedule
3. **Check Your Account**: Log into My WM to view your service details

**Typical Schedule Information:**
• **Trash Pickup**: Usually 1-2 times per week
• **Recycling Pickup**: Usually once per week
• **Yard Waste**: Seasonal service, typically once per week
• **Bulk Pickup**: By appointment only

**Schedule Factors:**
• Your specific address and service zone
• Service type (residential vs. commercial)
• Local regulations and franchise agreements
• Holiday schedules and weather delays

**Holiday Schedule Changes:**
• Service may be delayed by one day following holidays
• Check for service alerts during holiday weeks
• Major holidays affecting service: New Year's Day, Independence Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas

**Need Your Specific Schedule?**
Contact us with your address and we'll provide your exact pickup days and times.
alt_questions: About: what are my pickup days and schedule
What are my pickup days and schedule?

title: How do I change my container size?
content:
You can change your container size at any time to better fit your household's needs.

**Available Container Sizes:**
• **32-gallon**: Small households (1-2 people)
• **64-gallon**: Medium households (3-4 people)
• **96-gallon**: Large households (5+ people)

**How to Change Your Container Size:**
1. **Contact Customer Service**: Call or use our chat assistant
2. **Specify New Size**: Tell us which size you need
3. **Schedule Exchange**: We'll arrange delivery and pickup
4. **Container Exchange**: New container delivered, old one picked up

**Timeline:**
• Container exchange typically completed within 3-5 business days
• No service interruption during the change
• Continue using current container until exchange

**Pricing Changes:**
• Monthly rates adjust based on new container size
• Changes take effect on your next billing cycle
• No additional fees for the container exchange

**Considerations:**
• **Upgrading**: May increase monthly cost but provides more capacity
• **Downgrading**: May reduce monthly cost but provides less capacity
• **Frequency**: You can change sizes as often as needed

**Need Help Choosing?**
Contact us to discuss your household's needs and we'll recommend the best size for you.
alt_questions: About: how do i change my container size
How do I change my container size?

title: Can I temporarily suspend my service?
content:
Yes, you can temporarily suspend your service for vacations, extended absences, or other temporary situations.

**Service Hold Options:**
• **Temporary Hold**: Suspend service for 1-12 weeks
• **Vacation Hold**: Short-term suspension for travel
• **Seasonal Hold**: For seasonal residents

**How to Request a Service Hold:**
1. **Contact Customer Service**: Call or chat with us at least 3 business days in advance
2. **Specify Dates**: Provide start and end dates for the hold
3. **Choose Services**: Select which services to suspend (trash, recycling, yard waste)
4. **Container Storage**: We'll arrange to pick up your containers

**What Happens During Hold:**
• Containers are picked up and stored
• No service charges during hold period
• Service automatically resumes on specified date
• Containers redelivered before service resumes

**Important Considerations:**
• **Minimum Duration**: 1 week minimum hold period
• **Maximum Duration**: 12 weeks maximum hold period
• **Advance Notice**: 3 business days notice required
• **Container Storage**: We store containers during hold period

**Resuming Service:**
• Service automatically resumes on your specified date
• Containers redelivered 1-2 days before service resumes
• Billing resumes with your next billing cycle

**Need to Extend or Shorten Hold?**
Contact us to modify your hold dates with 3 business days notice.
alt_questions: About: can i temporarily suspend my service
Can I temporarily suspend my service?
